bigip-resource-datagroup-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_datagroup" "$1" {
    # type - (Required) datagroup type (applies to the `name` field of the record), supports: `string`, `ip` or `integer`
    type = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the datagroup
    name = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required if `record` defined), sets the value of the record's `name` attribute, must be of type defined in `type` attribute
    name = ""

    # data - (Optional) (Optional if `record` defined), sets the value of the record's `data` attribute, specifying a value here will create a record in the form of `name := data`
    data = ""

    # data - (Optional) (Optional if `record` defined), sets the value of the record's `data` attribute, specifying a value here will create a record in the form of `name := data`
    data = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-datagroup-x.description: `bigip_ltm_datagroup` Manages internal (in-line) datagroup configuration Resource should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource, for example /Common/my-datagroup.

bigip-resource-device-x.description: `bigip_cm_device` provides details about a specific bigip This resource is helpful when configuring the BIG-IP device in cluster or in HA mode.

bigip-resource-devicegroup-x.body:
resource "bigip_cm_devicegroup" "$1" {
    # bigip_cm_devicegroup - (Optional) Is the resource  used to configure new device group on the BIG-IP.
    bigip_cm_devicegroup = ""

    # name - (Optional) Is the name of the device Group
    name = ""

    # auto_sync - (Optional) Specifies if the device-group will automatically sync configuration data to its members
    auto_sync = ""

    # type - (Optional) Specifies if the device-group will be used for failover or resource syncing
    type = ""

    # device - (Optional) Name of the device to be included in device group, this need to be configured before using devicegroup resource
    device = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-devicegroup-x.description: `bigip_cm_devicegroup` A device group is a collection of BIG-IP devices that are configured to securely synchronize their BIG-IP configuration data, and fail over when needed.

bigip-resource-dns-x.body:
resource "bigip_sys_dns" "$1" {
    # description - (Optional) `description`- Provide description for your DNS server
    description = ""

    # name_servers - (Optional) Name or IP address of the DNS server
    name_servers = ""

    # number_of_dots - (Optional) Configures the number of dots needed in a name before an initial absolute query will be made.
    number_of_dots = ""

    # search - (Optional) Specify what domains you want to search
    search = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-dns-x.description: `bigip_ltm_dns` Configures DNS server on F5 BIG-IP

bigip-resource-iapp-x.body:
resource "bigip_sys_iapp" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional)  Name of the iApp.
    name = ""

    # jsonfile - (Optional) Refer to the Json file which will be deployed on F5 BIG-IP.
    jsonfile = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-iapp-x.description: `bigip_sys_iapp` resource helps you to deploy Application Services template that can be used to automate and orchestrate Layer 4-7 applications service deployments using F5 Network.

bigip-resource-irule-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_irule" "$1" {
    # irule - (Required) Body of the iRule
    irule = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the iRule
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-irule-x.description: `bigip_ltm_irule` Creates iRule on BIG-IP F5 device For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-monitor-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_monitor" "$1" {
    # parent - (Required) Existing LTM monitor to inherit from
    parent = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the monitor
    name = ""

    # interval - (Optional) Check interval in seconds
    interval = ""

    # timeout - (Optional) Timeout in seconds
    timeout = ""

    # send - (Optional) Request string to send
    send = ""

    # receive - (Optional) Expected response string
    receive = ""

    # receive_disable - (Optional) 
    receive_disable = ""

    # reverse - (Optional) 
    reverse = ""

    # transparent - (Optional) 
    transparent = ""

    # manual_resume - (Optional) 
    manual_resume = ""

    # ip_dscp - (Optional) 
    ip_dscp = ""

    # time_until_up - (Optional) 
    time_until_up = ""

    # destination - (Optional) Specify an alias address for monitoring
    destination = ""

    # compatibility - (Optional) Specifies, when enabled, that the SSL options setting (in OpenSSL) is set to ALL. Accepts 'enabled' or 'disabled' values, the default value is 'enabled'.
    compatibility = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-monitor-x.description: `bigip_ltm_monitor` Configures a custom monitor for use by health checks. For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-node-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_node" "$1" {
    # address - (Required) IP or hostname of the node
    address = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the node
    name = ""

    # connection_limit - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of connections allowed for the node or node address.
    connection_limit = ""

    # dynamic_ratio - (Optional) Specifies the fixed ratio value used for a node during ratio load balancing.
    dynamic_ratio = ""

    # monitor - (Optional) specifies the name of the monitor or monitor rule that you want to associate with the node.
    monitor = ""

    # rate_limit - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of connections per second allowed for a node or node address. The default value is 'disabled'.
    rate_limit = ""

    # state - (Optional) Default is "user-up" you can set to "user-down" if you want to disable
    state = ""

    # interval - (Optional) Specifies the amount of time before sending the next DNS query. Default is 3600. This needs to be specified inside the fqdn (fully qualified domain name).
    interval = ""

    # address_family - (Optional) Specifies the node's address family. The default is 'unspecified', or IP-agnostic. This needs to be specified inside the fqdn (fully qualified domain name).
    address_family = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-node-x.description: `bigip_ltm_node` Manages a node configuration For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-ntp-x.body:
resource "bigip_sys_ntp" "$1" {
    # bigip_sys_ntp - (Optional) Is the resource is used to configure ntp server on the BIG-IP.
    bigip_sys_ntp = ""

    # servers - (Optional) Adds NTP servers to or deletes NTP servers from the BIG-IP system.
    servers = ""

    # timezone - (Optional) Specifies the time zone that you want to use for the system time.
    timezone = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-ntp-x.description: `bigip_sys_ntp` provides details about a specific bigip This resource is helpful when configuring NTP server on the BIG-IP.

bigip-resource-persistence_profile_srcad.description: Configures a source address persistence profile

bigip-resource-policy-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_policy" "$1" {
    # tm_name - (Required) If Rule is used then you need to provide the tm_name it can be any value
    tm_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the Policy
    name = ""

    # strategy - (Optional) Specifies the match strategy
    strategy = ""

    # requires - (Optional) Specifies the protocol
    requires = ""

    # published_copy - (Optional) If you want to publish the policy else it will be deployed in Drafts mode.
    published_copy = ""

    # controls - (Optional) Specifies the controls
    controls = ""

    # rule - (Optional) Rules can be applied using the policy
    rule = ""

    # forward - (Optional) This action will affect forwarding.
    forward = ""

    # pool - (Optional) (Optional ) This action will direct the stream to this pool.
    pool = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-policy-x.description: `bigip_ltm_policy` Configures Virtual Server For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-pool-attachment-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_pool_attachment" "$1" {
    # node - (Required) Node to add to the pool in /Partition/NodeName:Port format (e.g. /Common/Node01:80)
    node = ""

    # pool - (Required) Name of the pool in /Partition/Name format
    pool = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-pool-attachment-x.description: `bigip_ltm_pool_attachment` Manages nodes membership in pools Resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-pool-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_pool" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the pool
    name = ""

    # monitors - (Optional) List of monitor names to associate with the pool
    monitors = ""

    # allow_nat - (Optional) 
    allow_nat = ""

    # allow_snat - (Optional) 
    allow_snat = ""

    # load_balancing_mode - (Optional) (Optional, Default = round-robin)
    load_balancing_mode = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-pool-x.description: `bigip_ltm_pool` Manages a pool configuration. Resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-profile_fasthttp-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_profile_fasthttp" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the profile_fasthttp
    name = ""

    # defaults_from - (Optional) Specifies the profile that you want to use as the parent profile. Your new profile inherits all settings and values from the parent profile specified.
    defaults_from = ""

    # connpoolidle_timeoutoverride - (Optional) Specifies the number of seconds after which a server-side connection in a OneConnect pool is eligible for deletion, when the connection has no traffic.The value of this option overrides the idle-timeout value that you specify. The default value is 0 (zero) seconds, which disables the override setting.
    connpoolidle_timeoutoverride = ""

    # connpool_maxreuse - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of times that the system can re-use a current connection. The default value is 0 (zero).
    connpool_maxreuse = ""

    # connpool_maxsize - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of connections to a load balancing pool. A setting of 0 specifies that a pool can accept an unlimited number of connections. The default value is 2048.
    connpool_maxsize = ""

    # connpool_replenish - (Optional) The default value is enabled. When this option is enabled, the system replenishes the number of connections to a load balancing pool to the number of connections that existed when the server closed the connection to the pool. When disabled, the system replenishes the connection that was closed by the server, only when there are fewer connections to the pool than the number of connections set in the connpool-min-size connections option. Also see the connpool-min-size option..
    connpool_replenish = ""

    # idle_timeout - (Optional) Specifies an idle timeout in seconds. This setting specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion.When you specify an idle timeout for the Fast L4 profile, the value must be greater than the bigdb database variable Pva.Scrub time in msec for it to work properly.The default value is 300 seconds.
    idle_timeout = ""

    # connpool_minsize - (Optional) Specifies the minimum number of connections to a load balancing pool. A setting of 0 specifies that there is no minimum. The default value is 10.
    connpool_minsize = ""

    # connpool_step - (Optional) Specifies the increment in which the system makes additional connections available, when all available connections are in use. The default value is 4.
    connpool_step = ""

    # maxheader_size - (Optional) Specifies the maximum amount of HTTP header data that the system buffers before making a load balancing decision. The default setting is 32768.
    maxheader_size = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-profile_fasthttp-x.description: `bigip_ltm_profile_fasthttp` Configures a custom profile_fasthttp for use by health checks. For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-profile_fastl4-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_profile_fastl4" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the profile_fastl4
    name = ""

    # defaults_from - (Optional) Specifies the profile that you want to use as the parent profile. Your new profile inherits all settings and values from the parent profile specified.
    defaults_from = ""

    # partition - (Optional) Displays the administrative partition within which this profile resides
    partition = ""

    # client_timeout - (Optional) Specifies late binding client timeout in seconds. This setting specifies the number of seconds allowed for a client to transmit enough data to select a server when late binding is enabled. If it expires timeout-recovery mode will dictate what action to take.
    client_timeout = ""

    # explicitflow_migration - (Optional) Enables or disables late binding explicit flow migration that allows iRules to control when flows move from software to hardware. Explicit flow migration is disabled by default hence BIG-IP automatically migrates flows from software to hardware.
    explicitflow_migration = ""

    # hardware_syncookie - (Optional) Enables or disables hardware SYN cookie support when PVA10 is present on the system. Note that when you set the hardware syncookie option to enabled, you may also want to set the following bigdb database variables using the "/sys modify db" command, based on your requirements: pva.SynCookies.Full.ConnectionThreshold (default: 500000), pva.SynCookies.Assist.ConnectionThreshold (default: 500000) pva.SynCookies.ClientWindow (default: 0). The default value is disabled.
    hardware_syncookie = ""

    # idle_timeout - (Optional) Specifies an idle timeout in seconds. This setting specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion.When you specify an idle timeout for the Fast L4 profile, the value must be greater than the bigdb database variable Pva.Scrub time in msec for it to work properly.The default value is 300 seconds.
    idle_timeout = ""

    # iptos_toclient - (Optional) Specifies an IP ToS number for the client side. This option specifies the Type of Service level that the traffic management system assigns to IP packets when sending them to clients. The default value is 65535 (pass-through), which indicates, do not modify.
    iptos_toclient = ""

    # iptos_toserver - (Optional) Specifies an IP ToS number for the server side. This setting specifies the Type of Service level that the traffic management system assigns to IP packets when sending them to servers. The default value is 65535 (pass-through), which indicates, do not modify.
    iptos_toserver = ""

    # keepalive_interval - (Optional) Specifies the keep alive probe interval, in seconds. The default value is disabled (0 seconds).
    keepalive_interval = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-profile_fastl4-x.description: `bigip_ltm_profile_fastl4` Configures a custom profile_fastl4 for use by health checks. For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-profile_http2-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_profile_http2" "$1" {
    # defaults_from - (Required) Specifies the profile that you want to use as the parent profile. Your new profile inherits all settings and values from the parent profile specified.
    defaults_from = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the profile_http2
    name = ""

    # concurrent_streams_per_connection - (Optional) Specifies how many concurrent requests are allowed to be outstanding on a single HTTP/2 connection.
    concurrent_streams_per_connection = ""

    # connection_idle_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion..
    connection_idle_timeout = ""

    # connpool_maxsize - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of connections to a load balancing pool. A setting of 0 specifies that a pool can accept an unlimited number of connections. The default value is 2048.
    connpool_maxsize = ""

    # activation_modes - (Optional) Specifies what will cause an incoming connection to be handled as a HTTP/2 connection. The default values npn and alpn specify that the TLS next-protocol-negotiation and application-layer-protocol-negotiation extensions will be used.
    activation_modes = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-profile_http2-x.description: `bigip_ltm_profile_http2` Configures a custom profile_http2 for use by health checks. For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-profile_httpcompress-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_profile_httpcompress" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the profile_httpcompress
    name = ""

    # defaults_from - (Optional) Specifies the profile that you want to use as the parent profile. Your new profile inherits all settings and values from the parent profile specified.
    defaults_from = ""

    # uri_exclude - (Optional) Disables compression on a specified list of HTTP Request-URI responses. Use a regular expression to specify a list of URIs you do not want to compress.
    uri_exclude = ""

    # uri_include - (Optional) Enables compression on a specified list of HTTP Request-URI responses. Use a regular expression to specify a list of URIs you want to compress.
    uri_include = ""

    # content_type_include - (Optional) Specifies a list of content types for compression of HTTP Content-Type responses. Use a string list to specify a list of content types you want to compress.
    content_type_include = ""

    # content_type_exclude - (Optional) Excludes a specified list of content types from compression of HTTP Content-Type responses. Use a string list to specify a list of content types you want to compress.
    content_type_exclude = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-profile_httpcompress-x.description: `bigip_ltm_profile_httpcompress`  Virtual server HTTP compression profile configuration For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-profile_oneconnect-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_profile_oneconnect" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the profile_oneconnect
    name = ""

    # partition - (Optional) Displays the administrative partition within which this profile resides
    partition = ""

    # defaults_from - (Optional) Specifies the profile that you want to use as the parent profile. Your new profile inherits all settings and values from the parent profile specified.
    defaults_from = ""

    # idle_timeout_override - (Optional) Specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection flow is eligible for deletion. Possible values are disabled, indefinite, or a numeric value that you specify. The default value is disabled.
    idle_timeout_override = ""

    # share_pools - (Optional) Specify if you want to share the pool, default value is "disabled"
    share_pools = ""

    # max_age - (Optional) Specifies the maximum age in number of seconds allowed for a connection in the connection reuse pool. For any connection with an age higher than this value, the system removes that connection from the reuse pool. The default value is 86400.
    max_age = ""

    # max_reuse - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of times that a server-side connection can be reused. The default value is 1000.
    max_reuse = ""

    # max_size - (Optional) Specifies the maximum number of connections that the system holds in the connection reuse pool. If the pool is already full, then the server-side connection closes after the response is completed. The default value is 10000.
    max_size = ""

    # source_mask - (Optional) Specifies a source IP mask. The default value is 0.0.0.0. The system applies the value of this option to the source address to determine its eligibility for reuse. A mask of 0.0.0.0 causes the system to share reused connections across all clients. A host mask (all 1's in binary), causes the system to share only those reused connections originating from the same client IP address.
    source_mask = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-profile_oneconnect-x.description: `bigip_ltm_profile_oneconnect` Configures a custom profile_oneconnect for use by health checks. For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-profile_tcp-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_profile_tcp" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the profile_tcp
    name = ""

    # partition - (Optional) Displays the administrative partition within which this profile resides
    partition = ""

    # defaults_from - (Optional) Specifies the profile that you want to use as the parent profile. Your new profile inherits all settings and values from the parent profile specified.
    defaults_from = ""

    # idle_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion. The default value is 300 seconds.
    idle_timeout = ""

    # close_wait_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the number of seconds that a connection remains in a LAST-ACK state before quitting. A value of 0 represents a term of forever (or until the maxrtx of the FIN state). The default value is 5 seconds.
    close_wait_timeout = ""

    # finwait_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the number of seconds that a connection is in the FIN-WAIT-1 or closing state before quitting. The default value is 5 seconds. A value of 0 (zero) represents a term of forever (or until the maxrtx of the FIN state). You can also specify immediate or indefinite.
    finwait_timeout = ""

    # keepalive_interval - (Optional) Specifies the keep alive probe interval, in seconds. The default value is 1800 seconds.
    keepalive_interval = ""

    # fast_open - (Optional) When enabled, permits TCP Fast Open, allowing properly equipped TCP clients to send data with the SYN packet.
    fast_open = ""

    # deferred_accept - (Optional) Specifies, when enabled, that the system defers allocation of the connection chain context until the client response is received. This option is useful for dealing with 3-way handshake DOS attacks. The default value is disabled.
    deferred_accept = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-profile_tcp-x.description: `bigip_ltm_profile_tcp` Configures a custom profile_tcp for use by health checks. For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-provision-x.description: `bigip_sys_provision` provides details bout how to enable "ilx", "asm" "apm" resource on BIG-IP

bigip-resource-route-x.body:
resource "bigip_net_route" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the route
    name = ""

    # network - (Optional) The destination subnet and netmask for the route.
    network = ""

    # network - (Optional) Specifies a gateway address for the route.
    network = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-route-x.description: `bigip_net_route` Manages a route configuration For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-selfip-x.body:
resource "bigip_net_selfip" "$1" {
    # vlan - (Required) Specifies the VLAN for which you are setting a self IP address. This setting must be provided when a self IP is created.
    vlan = ""

    # ip - (Required) The Self IP's address and netmask.
    ip = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the selfip
    name = ""

    # traffic_group - (Optional) Specifies the traffic group, defaults to `traffic-group-local-only` if not specified.
    traffic_group = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-selfip-x.description: `bigip_net_selfip` Manages a selfip configuration Resource should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource, for example /Common/my-selfip.

bigip-resource-snat-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_snat" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the snat
    name = ""

    # partition - (Optional) Displays the administrative partition within which this profile resides
    partition = ""

    # origins - (Optional) IP or hostname of the snat
    origins = ""

    # snatpool - (Optional) Specifies the name of a SNAT pool. You can only use this option when automap and translation are not used.
    snatpool = ""

    # mirror - (Optional) Enables or disables mirroring of SNAT connections.
    mirror = ""

    # autolasthop - (Optional) Specifies whether to automatically map last hop for pools or not. The default is to use next level's default.
    autolasthop = ""

    # sourceport - (Optional) Specifies whether the system preserves the source port of the connection. The default is preserve. Use of the preserve-strict setting should be restricted to UDP only under very special circumstances such as nPath or transparent (that is, no translation of any other L3/L4 field), where there is a 1:1 relationship between virtual IP addresses and node addresses, or when clustered multi-processing (CMP) is disabled. The change setting is useful for obfuscating internal network addresses.
    sourceport = ""

    # translation - (Optional) Specifies the name of a translated IP address. Note that translated addresses are outside the traffic management system. You can only use this option when automap and snatpool are not used.
    translation = ""

    # vlansdisabled - (Optional) Disables the SNAT on all VLANs.
    vlansdisabled = ""

    # vlans - (Optional) Specifies the name of the VLAN to which you want to assign the SNAT. The default is vlans-enabled.
    vlans = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-snat-x.description: `bigip_ltm_snat` Manages a snat configuration For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-snatpool-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_snatpool" "$1" {
    # members - (Required) Specifies a translation address to add to or delete from a SNAT pool (at least one address is required)
    members = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the snatpool
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-snatpool-x.description: `bigip_ltm_snatpool` Collections of SNAT translation addresses Resource should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource, for example /Common/my-snatpool.

bigip-resource-snmp-x.body:
resource "bigip_sys_snmp" "$1" {
    # sys_contact - (Optional) Specifies the contact information for the system administrator.
    sys_contact = ""

    # sys_location - (Optional) Describes the system's physical location.
    sys_location = ""

    # allowedaddresses - (Optional) Configures hosts or networks from which snmpd can accept traffic. Entries go directly into hosts.allow.
    allowedaddresses = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-snmp-x.description: `bigip_sys_snmp` provides details bout how to enable "ilx", "asm" "apm" resource on BIG-IP

bigip-resource-snmp_traps-x.body:
resource "bigip_sys_snmp_traps" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) Name of the snmp trap.
    name = ""

    # community - (Optional) Specifies the community string used for this trap.
    community = ""

    # host - (Optional) The host the trap will be sent to.
    host = ""

    # description - (Optional) The port that the trap will be sent to.
    description = ""

    # port - (Optional) User defined description.
    port = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-snmp_traps-x.description: `bigip_sys_snmp_traps` provides details bout how to enable snmp_traps resource on BIG-IP

bigip-resource-virtual_address-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_virtual_address" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the virtual address
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the virtual address
    description = ""

    # advertize_route - (Optional) Enabled dynamic routing of the address
    advertize_route = ""

    # conn_limit - (Optional) (Optional, Default=0) Max number of connections for virtual address
    conn_limit = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) (Optional, Default=true) Enable or disable the virtual address
    enabled = ""

    # arp - (Optional) (Optional, Default=true) Enable or disable ARP for the virtual address
    arp = ""

    # auto_delete - (Optional) (Optional, Default=true) Automatically delete the virtual address with the virtual server
    auto_delete = ""

    # icmp_echo - (Optional) (Optional, Default=true) Enable/Disable ICMP response to the virtual address
    icmp_echo = ""

    # traffic_group - (Optional) (Optional, Default=/Common/traffic-group-1) Specify the partition and traffic group
    traffic_group = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-virtual_address-x.description: `bigip_ltm_virtual_address` Configures Virtual Server For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-virtual_server-x.body:
resource "bigip_ltm_virtual_server" "$1" {
    # destination - (Required) Destination IP
    destination = ""

    # port - (Required) Listen port for the virtual server
    port = ""

    # name - (Required) Name of the virtual server
    name = ""

    # pool - (Optional) Default pool name
    pool = ""

    # mask - (Optional) Mask can either be in CIDR notation or decimal, i.e.: 24 or 255.255.255.0. A CIDR mask of 0 is the same as 0.0.0.0
    mask = ""

    # source_address_translation - (Optional) Can be either omitted for none or the values automap or snat
    source_address_translation = ""

    # translate_address - (Optional) Enables or disables address translation for the virtual server. Turn address translation off for a virtual server if you want to use the virtual server to load balance connections to any address. This option is useful when the system is load balancing devices that have the same IP address.
    translate_address = ""

    # translate_port - (Optional) Enables or disables port translation. Turn port translation off for a virtual server if you want to use the virtual server to load balance connections to any service
    translate_port = ""

    # ip_protocol - (Optional) Specify the IP protocol to use with the the virtual server (all, tcp, or udp are valid)
    ip_protocol = ""

    # profiles - (Optional) List of profiles associated both client and server contexts on the virtual server. This includes protocol, ssl, http, etc.
    profiles = ""

    # client_profiles - (Optional) List of client context profiles associated on the virtual server. Not mutually exclusive with profiles and server_profiles
    client_profiles = ""

    # server_profiles - (Optional) List of server context profiles associated on the virtual server. Not mutually exclusive with profiles and client_profiles
    server_profiles = ""

    # source - (Optional) Specifies an IP address or network from which the virtual server will accept traffic.
    source = ""

    # rules - (Optional) The iRules you want run on this virtual server. iRules help automate the intercepting, processing, and routing of application traffic.
    rules = ""

    # snatpool - (Optional) Specifies the name of an existing SNAT pool that you want the virtual server to use to implement selective and intelligent SNATs. DEPRECATED - see Virtual Server Property Groups source-address-translation
    snatpool = ""

    # vlans - (Optional) The virtual server is enabled/disabled on this set of VLANs. See vlans-disabled and vlans-enabled.
    vlans = ""

    # vlans_enabled - (Optional) (Optional Bool) Enables the virtual server on the VLANs specified by the VLANs option.
    vlans_enabled = ""

    # vlans_disabled - (Optional) (Optional Bool) Disables the virtual server on the VLANs specified by the VLANs option.
    vlans_disabled = ""

    # persistence_profiles - (Optional) List of persistence profiles associated with the Virtual Server.
    persistence_profiles = ""

    # fallback_persistence_profile - (Optional) Specifies a fallback persistence profile for the Virtual Server to use when the default persistence profile is not available.
    fallback_persistence_profile = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-virtual_server-x.description: `bigip_ltm_virtual_server` Configures Virtual Server For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

bigip-resource-vlan-x.body:
resource "bigip_net_vlan" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the vlan
    name = ""

    # tag - (Optional) Specifies a number that the system adds into the header of any frame passing through the VLAN.
    tag = ""

    # interfaces - (Optional) Specifies which interfaces you want this VLAN to use for traffic management.
    interfaces = ""

    # vlanport - (Optional) Physical or virtual port used for traffic
    vlanport = ""

    # tagged - (Optional) Specifies a list of tagged interfaces or trunks associated with this VLAN. Note that you can associate tagged interfaces or trunks with any number of VLANs.
    tagged = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
bigip-resource-vlan-x.description: `bigip_net_vlan` Manages a vlan configuration For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.
